alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene; Miami; Montgomery (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 03 at 3:23PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WESTERN CLARK, NORTHWESTERN GREENE, MONTGOMERY AND SOUTHEASTERN MIAMI COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 323 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Trotwood, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Dayton, Springfield, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Trotwood, Miamisburg, Vandalia, Englewood, Tipp City, Moraine, New Carlisle, West Milton, Oakwood, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, West Carrollton, Enon and Brown. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 19 and 53. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 46 and 69. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
